Brendon Murphy writes here.

See also the archive & miscellaneous.

My experience runs from unix & linux system administration, to programming for the web. I'm a firm believer in open source, and spend much of my time these days in Ruby.

My passions include git, github, rspec, rails, jQuery, programming in general, and my girlfriend Arielle.

I like to hang out with other Ruby-ists in Orange County. You can connect with us at the monthly OC Ruby Users Group. We'd love to see you there.

WorkingWithRails is the online home of the world's community of Ruby on Rails users. Go check my profile there.

Mental Magic

Last night a few co-workers and I hopped over to the Pleasanton Regal theater to catch a flick. We saw “”http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0443543/“>The Illusionist”, which fortunately, turned out to be pretty good. Good, but not great. I say “fortunately” because I managed to confuse the film with “”http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0482571/“>The Prestige”, which though I’m sure vaguely similar in content, is in fact, an entirely different film. I realized this as, during the movie trailers, a promo for the real “Prestige” was shown. So for the next five minutes, I sat in flickering darkness, furiously scanning my brain to try and remember what movie we were indeed seeing. It wasn’t until Edward Nortan’s name came up in the opening credits that I figured it out. It’s a pretty funny experience sitting in the theater thinking “um, what movie am I about to see?”

And hopefully “The Prestige” will be better.

—Oct 16, 2006
